item.title: 全球金融首脑将在香港峰会上面临更严厉的中国问题
item.description:
Global investment bank and asset manager chiefs are reuniting in Hong Kong next week amid geopolitical tensions and China's economic slowdown, seeking to redefine their position in the world's second-largest economy and its offshore financial hub.翻译:在地缘政治紧张局势和中国经济放缓之际，全球投资银行和资产管理公司高管下周将在香港重聚，寻求重新定义他们在全球第二大经济体及其离岸金融中心的地位。

The Global Financial Leaders Investment Summit, a flagship event hosted by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, begins on Monday with participants including Goldman Sachs (GS.N) Chief Executive David Solomon, Morgan Stanley (MS.N) boss James Gorman, Citigroup's (C.N) Jane Fraser, as well as HSBC's (HSBA.L) Noel Quinn and Standard Chartered's (STAN.L) Bill Winters.翻译:由香港金融管理局主办的旗舰活动全球金融领袖投资峰会于周一开幕，与会者包括高盛(GS.N)首席执行官大卫·所罗门 (David Solomon)、摩根士丹利(MS.N)总裁詹姆斯·戈尔曼 (James Gorman)、花旗集团(CN ) 首席执行官詹姆斯·戈尔曼 (James Gorman) 等。 ）简·弗雷泽（Jane Fraser），以及汇丰银行（HSBA.L）的诺埃尔·奎因（Noel Quinn）和渣打银行（STAN.L）的比尔·温特斯（Bill Winters）。

The heads of Blackstone Group, Carlyle Group, Citadel and others will also speak at the event, which focuses on the main theme of "living with complexity".翻译:黑石集团、凯雷集团、Citadel 等公司的负责人也将在活动上发表讲话，活动围绕“复杂生活”的主题。

The executives are coming to Hong Kong as the city has shed hundreds of banking and asset management jobs because of the slowdown in China dealmaking and the tightened regulatory grip on the market since the inaugural summit last year. That meeting was billed as Hong Kong's comeback as a global financial hub following the disruptions of the COVID-19 pandemic.翻译:这些高管即将来到香港，因为自去年首届峰会以来，由于中国交易放缓以及对市场的监管收紧，香港已经裁掉了数百个银行和资产管理职位。这次会议被认为是香港在受到新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 大流行破坏后重新成为全球金融中心的标志。

"The main question in the mind of everybody when they come to Hong Kong is how is the Chinese economy performing and what would be the swings coming from there," said Diana Parusheva-Lowery, head of public policy and sustainable finance at the Asia Securities Industry & Financial Markets Association in Hong Kong.翻译:亚洲证券公共政策和可持续金融主管戴安娜·帕鲁舍娃-洛厄里(Diana Parusheva-Lowery)表示：“每个人来到香港时，脑子里的主要问题是中国经济表现如何，以及随之而来的波动是什么。”香港工业及金融市场协会。

The Hong Kong Stock Exchange is only the 11th-largest venue for initial public offerings this year, with merely $2.7 billion raised through the third quarter, a shadow of its top position in most of the last decade. The territory's assets under management fell by 14% in 2022, official data showed.翻译:香港证券交易所仅是今年第 11 大首次公开募股交易场所，第三季度仅筹集了 27 亿美元，与其在过去十年大部分时间里排名第一的地位相形见绌。官方数据显示，2022 年该地区管理的资产下降了 14%。

Trading volumes have also slumped as foreign investors reduce exposure to a China they view as increasingly isolated by its opaque policies, struggling property sector and crackdowns on private enterprise.翻译:由于外国投资者认为中国因不透明的政策、陷入困境的房地产业和对私营企业的打击而日益孤立，因此减少了对中国的投资，交易量也大幅下降。

"The structural slowdown in China's economy, the omnipresent risk that U.S.-China relations might take another leg down in the future, the questions about whether private mainland money now prefers Singapore, none of that has really changed," said Chris Beddor, Gavekal Dragonomics' deputy China research director based in Hong Kong.翻译:龙洲经讯的 Chris Beddor 表示：“中国经济的结构性放缓、中美关系未来可能再次下滑的普遍风险、大陆私人资金现在是否更青睐新加坡的问题，这些都没有真正改变。”驻香港的中国研究副总监。

"And senior people in the financial sector are keenly aware of those issues, even if they don't discuss them publicly," Beddor said.翻译:贝多尔说：“金融领域的资深人士敏锐地意识到这些问题，即使他们没有公开讨论这些问题。”

STRING OF LAYOFFS

Hong Kong's financial job market, which saw an exodus of foreign employees during COVID, is unlikely to recover in the near term amid a challenging operating environment, recruiters and industry insiders say.翻译:招聘人员和业内人士表示，在新冠疫情期间，香港的金融就业市场出现了外籍员工大量外流的情况，但由于经营环境充满挑战，短期内不太可能恢复。

Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley and J.P. Morgan have trimmed dozens of bankers based in Hong Kong and mainland China this year, with key China dealmakers among those laid off.翻译:高盛、摩根士丹利和摩根大通今年已裁减了驻香港和中国大陆的数十名银行家，其中包括主要的中国交易撮合者。

The surprise merger between Swiss banking rivals UBS and Credit Suisse resulted in a brutal 80% reduction in the Credit Suisse investment banking staff in Hong Kong in August.翻译:瑞士银行业竞争对手瑞银集团(UBS)和瑞士信贷银行(Credit Suisse)出人意料地合并，导致瑞士信贷银行(Credit Suisse)在香港的投资银行员工8月份大幅裁员80% 。

Canada's largest pension fund CPP Investment also cut a number of Hong Kong-based staff members.翻译:加拿大最大的养老基金CPP Investment也裁减了多名香港员工。

John Mullally, recruiter Robert Walters' Hong Kong managing director, said hiring in private banking remains active, helped by wealth coming out of China to Hong Kong after the border reopened.翻译:招聘人员罗伯特·沃尔特斯(Robert Walters)香港董事总经理约翰·穆拉利(John Mulally)表示，私人银行业的招聘仍然活跃，这得益于边境重新开放后财富从中国流入香港。

Hong Kong needs to be aware of competition from rival financial hub Singapore but Mullally expects Hong Kong to "regain some of the ground lost" despite the depressed dealmaking and trading.翻译:香港需要意识到来自竞争对手金融中心新加坡的竞争，但穆拉利预计，尽管交易和贸易低迷，香港仍将“收复部分失地”。

Reporting by Kane Wu in Hong Kong and Scott Murdoch in Sydney; additional reporting by Selena Li and Xie Yu; Editing by Christian Schmollinger翻译:吴凯恩 (Kane Wu) 在香港的报道和斯科特·默多克 (Scott Murdoch) 在悉尼的报道； Selena Li 和 Xie Yu 的补充报道；克里斯蒂安·施莫林格编辑

item.title: 利率上涨，股市将迎来 2023 年最强劲的一周
item.description:
Stocks were headed for their biggest weekly rise in a year on Friday, while bonds rallied and the dollar was on the back foot as investors cheered a pause in U.S. interest rate hikes.翻译:周五，股市将创下一年来最大单周涨幅，而债券则上涨，美元则处于不利地位，因为投资者对美国暂停加息感到高兴。

U.S. jobs data due later in the day is the next major focus.翻译:当天晚些时候公布的美国就业数据是下一个主要焦点。

Benchmark 10-year Treasury yields are down more than 20 basis points in two sessions since the U.S. Federal Reserve left rates on hold on Wednesday and Chair Jerome Powell said risks to the outlook for rates settings was balanced.翻译:自美联储周三维持利率不变且主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔表示利率设定前景面临的风险已平衡以来，基准10年期国债收益率在两个交易日内下跌了20多个基点。

Cash Treasuries were untraded in Asia as markets were closed in Tokyo due to a holiday, and 10-year futures held recent gains to imply yields were steady at 4.67%. MSCI's broadest index of Asia-Pacific shares outside Japan (.MIAPJ0000PUS) rose 0.9%.翻译:由于东京市场因假期休市，亚洲现金国债没有交易，10 年期期货保持近期涨幅，意味着收益率稳定在 4.67%。 MSCI 日本以外亚太地区最广泛股票指数(.MIAPJ0000PUS)上涨 0.9%。

S&P 500 futures were 0.1% lower, weighed by a 3% fall for Apple (AAPL.O) shares in post-market trade after the tech giant's sales forecast fell short of expectations.翻译:标准普尔 500 指数期货下跌 0.1%，因科技巨头苹果公司(AAPL.O)的销售预测未达到预期，其股价在盘后交易中下跌 3%。

World stocks (.MIWD00000PUS) are up 4.2% for the week so far, their largest weekly rise since November 2022.翻译:迄今为止，全球股市(.MIWD00000PUS)本周上涨 4.2%，这是自 2022 年 11 月以来的最大单周涨幅。

"Markets have become increasingly confident that rates in the U.S. have now peaked," said ANZ analysts in a note.翻译:澳新银行分析师在一份报告中表示：“市场对美国利率现已见顶越来越有信心。”

"As logical as that is ... Powell did warn that for higher bond yields to forestall another hike, they'd need to stay high, so markets can't have their proverbial cake and eat it too."翻译:“尽管这是合乎逻辑的……鲍威尔确实警告说，为了防止再次加息，债券收益率需要保持在高位，这样市场就不能鱼与熊掌兼得。”

The U.S. Treasury department had also said on Wednesday that it would sell less longer-dated debt at auction than had been expected and a softer-than-forecast manufacturing survey helped reinforce bets that no further hikes are necessary.翻译:美国财政部周三还表示，将在拍卖中出售的较长期债券数量少于预期，而制造业调查数据弱于预期，这也增强了人们对没有必要进一步加息的押注。

On Thursday, the Bank of England also left interest rates on hold and stressed it did not expect to cut them any time soon.翻译:周四， 英国央行也维持利率不变，并强调预计不会很快降息。

Ten-year gilts had their sharpest rally in more than a month, sending yields almost 12 basis points lower to 4.39%. Ten-year German bund yields also fell on Thursday, though only by 4.6 bps to 2.71%.翻译:十年期英国国债出现一个多月以来的最大涨幅，导致收益率下跌近 12 个基点至 4.39%。德国十年期国债收益率周四也下跌，但仅下跌 4.6 个基点至 2.71%。

"It felt like there were a decent chunk of investors waiting on the sidelines and ready to play lower yields and yesterday removed a couple of potential stumbling blocks to enacting that view," said Rabobank analysts.翻译:荷兰合作银行分析师表示，“感觉有相当多的投资者在观望，准备降低收益率，昨天消除了实施这一观点的几个潜在障碍。”

PAYROLLS LOOM

In foreign exchange markets the Australian dollar is leading gains among G10 currencies this week after a third-quarter inflation surprise had traders betting on a rate hike from the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) on Tuesday.翻译:在外汇市场上，澳元本周在 G10 货币中领涨，此前第三季度通胀意外，交易员押注澳大利亚储备银行 (RBA) 周二加息。

Australian retail sales stumbled in the September quarter, with sales-per-person posting the largest annual drop on record, data on Friday showed.翻译:周五的数据显示，澳大利亚零售额在九月季度出现下滑，人均销售额创下有记录以来最大年度跌幅。

The Australian dollar is up 1.5% to $0.6430 and has broken above its 50-day moving average. The New Zealand dollar is not far behind with a 1.4% gain to $0.5892.翻译:澳元兑美元上涨 1.5% 至 0.6430 美元，并突破 50 日移动均线。新西兰元也不甘落后，上涨 1.4% 至 0.5892 美元。

"Money markets are more than fully priced for another RBA hike by Q1, eye-catching in the G10. So the Aussie has a degree of support from RBA expectations that it has rarely had since the pandemic," said Westpac analyst Sean Callow.翻译:西太平洋银行(Westpac)分析师肖恩·卡洛(Sean Callow)表示，“货币市场已经充分消化了澳大利亚央行第一季度再次加息的可能性，这在十国集团中引人注目。因此，澳大利亚央行的预期为澳元提供了一定程度的支撑，这是自疫情以来罕见的。”

"(But) a run at $0.65 is likely to require either a notably weak U.S. jobs report or a hawkish hike from the RBA."翻译:“（但是）0.65美元的挤兑可能需要美国就业报告显着疲软或澳大利亚央行采取鹰派加息。”

Economists polled by Reuters expect the U.S. to have added 180,000 jobs in October.翻译:路透社调查的经济学家预计美国10月份将增加18万个就业岗位。

The worst performing G10 currencies for the week have been the havens of Japanese yen and the Swiss franc as investors have sought out riskier assets.翻译:由于投资者纷纷寻找风险较高的资产，本周表现最差的 G10 货币是日元和瑞士法郎的避险货币。

The Bank of Japan will continue to dismantle its ultra-easy monetary policy next year, six sources familiar with the BOJ's thinking told Reuters, though the slow progress has been cold comfort for a yen weighed down by Japan's low interest rates.翻译:六位熟悉日本央行想法的消息人士告诉路透社，日本央行明年将继续取消其超宽松货币政策，不过进展缓慢对因日本低利率打压的日元来说是一个冰冷的安慰。

It traded at 150.44 per dollar on Friday. Brent crude futures are 4% lower on the week to $86.80 a barrel. Gold is down 1% at $1,983 an ounce.翻译:周五其交易价格为 150.44 美元。布伦特原油期货本周下跌 4%，至每桶 86.80 美元。黄金下跌 1%，至每盎司 1,983 美元。

Bitcoin has surged 15% with the mood and looks to be reviving momentum that had collapsed along with exchange FTX in 2022. FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried was found guilty of stealing from customers on Thursday. Bitcoin bought $34,600.翻译:比特币在这种情绪下飙升了 15%，看起来正在恢复 2022 年 FTX 交易所崩溃的势头。FTX 创始人Sam Bankman-Fried 于周四被判犯有盗窃客户罪。比特币买入 34,600 美元。

Reporting by Tom Westbrook; Editing by Jacqueline Wong翻译:汤姆·威斯布鲁克报道；编辑：黄杰奎琳

item.title: 独家：日元疲软迫使日本缩减历史性的军费开支计划
item.description:
A collapse in the yen is forcing Japan to scale back a historic five-year, 43.5-trillion-yen defence build-up aimed at helping to deter a Chinese invasion of Taiwan, according to eight people familiar with the matter.翻译:据八位知情人士透露，日元贬值正迫使日本缩减历时五年、耗资 43.5 万亿日元的国防建设计划，该建设旨在帮助阻止中国入侵台湾。

Since the plan was unveiled in December, the yen has lost 10% of its value against the dollar, forcing Tokyo to reduce its ambitious defence procurement plan, which was then-calculated to cost $320 billion, the sources said.翻译:消息人士称，自去年 12 月公布该计划以来，日元兑美元汇率已下跌 10%，迫使东京削减其雄心勃勃的国防采购计划，当时该计划耗资 3200 亿美元。

Reuters interviewed three government officials with direct knowledge of defence procurement and five industry sources, who said Japan will begin cutting back on aircraft purchases in 2024, the second year of the build-up, due to the weak yen.翻译:路透社采访了三名直接了解国防采购情况的政府官员和五名行业消息人士，他们表示，由于日元疲软，日本将在 2024 年（即飞机采购增加的第二年）开始削减飞机采购。

Details of how Japan is paring back military procurement due to currency fluctuations have not been previously reported. The eight people, who attended numerous meetings on the purchases, spoke on condition of anonymity because they were not authorised to talk to media.翻译:此前并未报道过日本如何因汇率波动而削减军事采购的细节。这八人参加了多次有关采购的会议，但由于无权接受媒体采访，因此要求匿名。

Tokyo assumed an exchange rate of 108 yen to the dollar - a rate last traded at in summer 2021 - when it began formulating purchase plans in December, the eight people said. By early November, the currency dipped to 151 to the dollar. The Bank of Japan on Tuesday took a small step toward ending the decade-long monetary stimulus, which has driven yen depreciation, by tweaking bond yield controls.翻译:这八位人士表示，东京在 12 月开始制定购买计划时，假设日元兑美元汇率为 108 日元，上次交易汇率是在 2021 年夏季。到 11 月初，该货币兑美元汇率跌至 151。日本央行周二通过调整债券收益率控制措施， 朝着结束长达十年的货币刺激措施迈出了一小步，这种刺激措施推动了日元贬值。

Unlike large companies that do business overseas, Japan's defence ministry does not hedge against currency rate fluctuations, one of the government officials said, meaning it has few means to mitigate the rising cost in yen of Tomahawk cruise missiles and F-35 stealth fighters.翻译:一位政府官员表示，与在海外开展业务的大公司不同，日本防卫省不会对冲汇率波动，这意味着它几乎没有办法缓解战斧巡航导弹和 F-35 隐形战斗机的日元成本上涨。

Any sign that Prime Minister Fumio Kishida will get less bang than anticipated from his military spending binge could stir unease in Washington about its key ally's ability to help contain Beijing, said Christopher Johnstone, Japan chair at the Center for Strategic and International Studies think tank.翻译:日本战略与国际研究中心智囊团主席克里斯托弗·约翰斯通表示，任何迹象表明日本首相岸田文雄的军费开支不会给华盛顿带来比预期更大的影响，这可能会引起华盛顿对其主要盟友帮助遏制北京的能力的不安。

"For now, the impact is modest. But there is no question that a long-term depreciation of the yen would sap the impact of Japan's build-up, and force cuts and delays to key acquisitions," said Johnstone, a former National Security Council director for East Asia in the Biden administration.翻译:“就目前而言，影响不大。但毫无疑问，日元长期贬值将削弱日本集结的影响，并迫使削减和​​推迟关键收购，”前国家安全官员约翰斯通表示。拜登政府东亚事务委员会主任。

Japan's Ministry of Defence said it does not discuss details of procurement planning when contacted for comment.翻译:日本防卫省表示，在联系其置评时不会讨论采购计划的细节。

The U.S. Embassy in Tokyo said it was unable to comment. The Pentagon did not immediately return a request for comment.翻译:美国驻东京大使馆表示无法发表评论。五角大楼没有立即回复置评请求。

BUILD-UP

Kishida described Japan's biggest defence build-up since World War Two as a "turning point in history." The spending is meant gird the nation for possible conflict around its far-flung islands stretching along the edge of the East China Sea toward Taiwan, according to defence white papers. Tokyo also shares responsibility for protecting U.S. bases on its soil that Washington could use to launch counter strikes against Chinese forces attacking the self-governing democratic island.翻译:岸田将日本自第二次世界大战以来最大规模的防御建设描述为“历史的转折点”。防务白皮书称，这笔开支是为了让国家应对可能发生的围绕东海边缘延伸至台湾的偏远岛屿的冲突。东京还分担保护其领土上的美国基地的责任，华盛顿可以利用这些基地对袭击这个自治民主岛屿的中国军队发动反击。

In December, Kishida pledged to double annual defence outlays to 2% of gross domestic product. A move to transform the war-renouncing nation into potentially the world's third-biggest military spender was seen by analysts and lawmakers as improbable until two years ago.翻译:12月，岸田承诺将年度国防开支翻一番，达到国内生产总值的2%。直到两年前，分析人士和立法者还认为，将这个放弃战争的国家转变为可能成为世界第三大军费开支国的举措是不可能的。

That changed when Russian forces rolled into Ukraine in February 2022, in an invasion that Tokyo worries will embolden Beijing to strike Taiwan.翻译:当俄罗斯军队于 2022 年 2 月进入乌克兰时，情况发生了变化，东京担心这次入侵将让北京更加大胆地攻击台湾。

China stoked Japanese fears again that August by firing missiles into waters close to its territory in response to then-U.S. house speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. That came after months of intensifying Chinese activity in East Asia, including joint sorties with Russian forces.翻译:那年八月，为了回应时任美国众议院议长南希·佩洛西访问台湾，中国向其领土附近海域发射导弹，再次激起了日本的担忧。此前几个月，中国加强了在东亚的活动，包括与俄罗斯军队的联合出动。

China, which has not ruled out using military force to bring Taiwan under its control, has expressed concern about Japan's military spending plans, accusing it of displaying a "Cold War mentality."翻译:中国不排除使用武力控制台湾，并对日本的军费开支计划表示担忧，指责其表现出“冷战思维”。

CHINOOKS AND SEAPLANES

With the cuts in its spending power, Japan decided to prioritize spending on advanced U.S.-made frontline weapons such as missiles that could halt advancing Chinese forces, the eight people said. That means less money on support aircraft and other secondary kit, much of it made by Japanese companies, they said.翻译:这八位人士表示，随着支出能力的削减，日本决定优先投资先进的美国制造的前线武器，例如可以阻止中国军队前进的导弹。他们说，这意味着支援飞机和其他辅助装备的资金减少，其中大部分是由日本公司制造的。

In December, defence ministry officials discussed an order for 34 twin-rotor Chinook transport helicopters at roughly 15 billion yen per aircraft, two of the sources said.翻译:两名消息人士称，去年 12 月，防卫省官员讨论了订购 34 架双旋翼支奴干运输直升机的事宜，每架飞机的价格约为 150 亿日元。

In the defence budget request for the year starting April 2024, which was published in August, that order was halved to 17 because the cost of the aircraft had jumped by around 5 billion yen each since December. About half that increase was due to the weak yen, said one of the government sources, who was directly involved in those discussions.翻译:在 8 月公布的 2024 年 4 月开始的年度防卫预算请求中，由于自 12 月以来每架飞机的成本增加了约 50 亿日元，该订单减少了一半至 17 架。一位直接参与这些讨论的政府消息人士表示，大约一半的增长是由于日元疲软造成的。

The aircraft are assembled by Kawasaki Heavy Industries (7012.T) under license from Boeing Co (BA.N). A Kawasaki spokesperson confirmed that the unit cost increase had resulted in a reduction in the Chinook order.翻译:该飞机由川崎重工(7012.T)在波音公司(BA.N)许可下组装。川崎发言人证实，单位成本增加导致“支奴干”订单减少。

Japan also scrapped a plan to buy two ShinMaywa Industries (7224.T) US-2 seaplanes used for search and rescue missions after the price per aircraft almost doubled to 30 billion yen compared with three years ago, said two other people familiar with the spending plans.翻译:另两位知情人士称，日本还取消了购买两架用于搜救任务的新明和工业公司(ShinMaywa Industries, 7224.T) US-2 水上飞机的计划，因为每架飞机的价格与三年前相比几乎翻了一番，达到 300 亿日元。计划。

"The price has risen considerably, and that is because the weaker yen and inflation have significantly pushed up costs," a company spokesperson said. She declined to comment on whether the defence ministry had dropped an order for the seaplane.翻译:公司发言人表示：“价格大幅上涨，是因为日元贬值和通胀大幅推高了成本。”她拒绝评论国防部是否放弃了这架水上飞机的订单。

INDUSTRY BACKLASH

For Kishida, who must grapple with rival ruling-party factions that are sparring over whether to borrow money or hike taxes to pay for his defence build-up, pruning equipment purchases may be politically less fraught than asking lawmakers for top-ups, analysts said.翻译:分析人士表示，对于岸田来说，他必须与执政党的敌对派系进行斗争，这些派系正在为是否借钱或提高税收来支付国防建设费用而争论不休，与要求议员补充资金相比，削减设备采购在政治上可能不会那么令人担忧。 。

"Whether Kishida decides to increase the budget or do nothing will depend on his support rate in Japan," said Yoji Koda, a retired Maritime Self Defense Force admiral, who commanded the Japanese fleet. He expects the Japanese leader to opt for procurement cuts or delays because it's easier than convincing taxpayers to fork out more money.翻译:“岸田是否决定增加预算或什么也不做，将取决于他在日本的支持率，”日本舰队司令、退役海上自卫队海军上将幸田洋二表示。他预计日本领导人会选择削减或推迟采购，因为这比说服纳税人支付更多资金更容易。

But, by sidestepping that challenge, Kishida is also inviting a backlash from Japanese companies that worry they will bear the brunt of cuts to ensure Tokyo can afford Raytheon (RTX.N) Tomahawks and the F-35 jets it has ordered from Lockheed Martin (LMT.N).翻译:但是，岸田回避这一挑战也招致了日本公司的强烈反对，这些公司担心自己将首当其冲地削减开支，以确保东京能够负担得起雷神公司 (RTX.N)战斧战斗机和从洛克希德·马丁公司订购的 F-35 喷气式飞机。 LMT.N） 。

In a sign of growing discontent, the Japan Business Federation, the country's most influential corporate lobby, joined several defence industry associations in October to press the defence ministry for extra military procurement funds in a supplementary budget now before parliament, one of the sources said.翻译:一位消息人士称，日本最有影响力的企业游说团体日本经济团体联合会于 10 月联合多个国防工业协会，向防卫省施压，要求在议会提交的补充预算中提供额外的军事采购资金，这是不满情绪日益增长的迹象。

A ministry spokesperson confirmed the companies delivered a letter on Oct 25 to Defence Minister Minoru Kihara urging the government to proceed with the defence procurement as planned.翻译:日本防卫省发言人证实，这些公司已于 10 月 25 日致函防卫大臣木原稔，敦促政府按计划进行国防采购。

The business lobby declined to comment.翻译:商业游说团体拒绝发表评论。

Defence firms will struggle to get more money because the government will want to hold off on adding to the 43 trillion-yen plan to see if the currency situation changes, said Kevin Maher at NMV Consulting in Washington, who headed the U.S. State Department's Office of Japan Affairs.翻译:美国国务院办公室负责人、华盛顿 NMV 咨询公司的凯文·马赫 (Kevin Maher) 表示，国防公司将很难获得更多资金，因为政府希望推迟增加 43 万亿日元计划，看看汇率情况是否会发生变化。日本事务。

"If they think it will impact capabilities then it is possible, but I think at the earliest that would be in the next to last year of the five-year plan," he said.翻译:他说：“如果他们认为这会影响能力，那么这是可能的，但我认为最早会在五年计划的最后一年发生。”

($1 = 150.4000 yen)翻译:（1 美元 = 150.4000 日元）

item.title: 财新PMI显示10月中国服务业活动小幅回升
item.description:
China's services activity expanded at a slightly faster pace in October, a private-sector survey showed on Friday, with sales growing at the softest rate in 10 months and employment stagnating as business confidence waned.翻译:周五的一项私营部门调查显示，中国 10 月份服务业活动扩张速度略快，销售增速创 10 个月来最低水平，且随着商业信心减弱，就业停滞。

The vast services sector, which provides about 48% of jobs in China, enjoyed a strong rebound earlier this year but analysts say the sluggish household income growth and uncertain job market raise questions over the sustainability of the industry's growth.翻译:庞大的服务业提供了中国约48%的就业机会，今年早些时候出现了强劲反弹，但分析人士表示，家庭收入增长缓慢和就业市场的不确定性引发了人们对该行业增长可持续性的质疑。

The Caixin/S&P Global services purchasing managers' index (PMI) rose to 50.4 in October from September's nine-month low of 50.2. The pace of expansion also remained much slower than seen on average in the first half of the year.翻译:10 月份财新/标普全球服务业采购经理人指数 (PMI) 从 9 月份的 9 个月低点 50.2 升至 50.4。扩张速度也仍远低于上半年的平均水平。

The 50-point mark separates expansion from contraction in activity.翻译:50 分是经济活动扩张与收缩的分界线。

An official survey showed on Tuesday that services PMI dropped to 50.1 from 50.9 in September.翻译:周二的官方调查显示，服务业 PMI 从 9 月份的 50.9 降至 50.1。

"The services sector, which is highly related to youth employment, recovered 90% to pre-COVID levels," said Xing Zhaopeng, senior China strategist at ANZ.翻译:澳新银行高级中国策略师邢兆鹏表示：“与青年就业高度相关的服务业已恢复至新冠疫情前水平90%。”

However, "it is unlikely to see a rebound beyond expectation in the sector," he added.翻译:然而，“该行业不太可能出现超出预期的反弹，”他补充道。

New orders in the services sector last month rose at the weakest pace in 10 months, the Caixin survey showed, offsetting the bump higher from a travel boom seen during the eight-day National Day holiday.翻译:财新调查显示，上个月服务业新订单增速为 10 个月以来最弱，抵消了国庆八天假期旅行热潮带来的增长。

However, there was further improvement in foreign demand for Chinese services amid reports of increased amounts of overseas visitors.翻译:然而，随着海外游客数量的增加，国外对中国服务的需求进一步改善。

The slowdown in sales growth led to companies' more cautious approach to recruitment. Employment in the sector was unchanged in October, having expanded in each of the previous eight months.翻译:销售增长放缓导致企业对招聘采取更加谨慎的态度。该行业的就业人数在 10 月份没有变化，在过去八个月中逐年扩大。

Amid subdued demand, overall optimism slipped for the fourth month in a row and was the lowest since March 2020.翻译:由于需求低迷，整体乐观情绪连续第四个月下滑，为 2020 年 3 月以来的最低水平。

Prices charged by services companies grew at a faster pace as they sought to pass on higher input costs to customers, though the rate of input inflation was the slowest since June 2022.翻译:尽管投入通胀率是 2022 年 6 月以来最慢的，但服务公司寻求将更高的投入成本转嫁给客户，因此其收取的价格增长较快。

Caixin/S&P's composite PMI, which includes both manufacturing and services activity, declined to 50.0 from 50.9 in September, marking the lowest reading since December 2022.翻译:财新/标普综合 PMI（包括制造业和服务业活动）从 9 月份的 50.9 降至 50.0，创下 2022 年 12 月以来的最低读数。

"The market conditions for manufacturing were more sluggish compared with the services sector," said Wang Zhe, economist at Caixin Insight Group.翻译:财新智库经济学家王哲表示：“与服务业相比，制造业的市场状况更加低迷。”

China's economy staged better-than-expected growth in the third quarter, but economists say the weak property sector, fading demand for travel, local government debt and geopolitical tensions may weigh on the outlook.翻译:中国经济第三季度的增长好于预期，但经济学家表示，房地产行业疲软、旅游需求下降、地方政府债务和地缘政治紧张局势可能会给经济前景带来压力。

Reporting by Ellen Zhang and Ryan Woo. Editing by Sam Holmes翻译:张艾伦和吴瑞安报道。山姆·霍姆斯编辑

item.title: 交易员押注美联储加息结束，美元走软
item.description:
The dollar stayed on the back foot on Friday and was on course for a weekly decline against a basket of currencies as traders wagered that the U.S. Federal Reserve was most likely done with rate increases, lifting risk sentiment.翻译:美元周五仍处于不利地位，兑一篮子货币本周可能下跌，因为交易员押注美联储很可能会加息，从而提振风险情绪。

The dollar index , which measures the U.S. currency against six rivals, was at 106.22, not far from the one-week low of 105.80 it hit on Thursday. The index is on course to clock a 0.3% drop for the week, just its third week of losses since July.翻译:衡量美元兑六种货币的美元指数为106.22，距离周四触及的一周低点105.80不远。该指数本周预计下跌 0.3%，这是自 7 月以来的第三周下跌。

Markets are now pricing in a less than 20% chance of a rate increase in December compared with 39% a month earlier, CME FedWatch tool showed, in the wake of the U.S. central bank's holding interest rates steady on Wednesday. The Fed, however, left the door open to a further increase in borrowing costs in a nod to the economy's resilience.翻译:CME FedWatch 工具显示，在美联储周三维持利率稳定后，市场目前预计 12 月加息的可能性不到 20%，而一个月前为 39%。然而，美联储为进一步提高借贷成本敞开了大门，以表彰经济的韧性。

Data on Thursday showed the number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits increased moderately last week as the labour market continued to show few signs of a significant slowdown.翻译:周四的数据 显示，上周美国新申请失业救济人数略有增加，因为劳动力市场仍然没有出现明显放缓的迹象。

"The dataflow was supportive for the notion of a soft landing and the end of the U.S. hiking cycle being nearer," said Tapas Strickland, head of market economics at NAB.翻译:国民银行市场经济主管塔帕斯·斯特里克兰 (Tapas Strickland) 表示：“数据流支持了软着陆的概念，并且美国加息周期即将结束。”

Investor focus will now be on October non-farm payrolls data later in the day, with consensus at 180,000 jobs, with a weaker result likely to put further pressure on the dollar.翻译:投资者现在的焦点将放在当天晚些时候公布的 10 月份非农就业数据上，市场一致认为就业人数为 18 万，而疲软的结果可能会给美元带来进一步的压力。

Analysts said any pullback in the dollar will probably be temporary, pointing to the strength in U.S. economy compared with the rest of the world.翻译:分析师表示，美元的任何回调都可能是暂时的，这表明美国经济与世界其他地区相比表现强劲。

"Global economy is going to slow down while the U.S. economy seems to be more resilient ... so Fed versus ECB, you might see more divergence and then the differential in real rates," said Flavio Carpenzano, Investment Director for fixed income at Capital Group. "This is the reason why over the next few months, it's difficult to see a big catalyst for the dollar to weaken."翻译:Capital固定收益投资总监弗拉维奥·卡彭扎诺(Flavio Carpenzano)表示：“全球经济将会放缓，而美国经济似乎更具弹性……因此，美联储与欧洲央行相比，你可能会看到更多的分歧，然后是实际利率的差异。”团体。 “这就是为什么在接下来的几个月里，很难看到美元走弱的重大催化剂的原因。”

The European Central Bank last week snapped a streak of 10 straight rate increases, with the discussion shifting to how long the rates would stay high.翻译:欧洲央行上周结束了连续十次加息，讨论转向利率将维持高位多久。

ECB board member Isabel Schnabel said on Thursday the central bank is on track to push inflation back down to 2% by 2025 but the "last mile" of disinflation may be the toughest, so the bank cannot yet close the door on further rate rises.翻译:欧洲央行董事会成员伊莎贝尔·施纳贝尔周四表示，央行有望在2025年之前将通胀率推低至2%，但通货紧缩的“最后一英里”可能是最艰难的，因此央行还不能关闭进一步加息的大门。

The euro was down 0.03% to $1.0617, having risen 0.49% on Thursday. The single currency is set to clock a weekly gain of 0.5%.翻译:欧元兑美元下跌0.03%至1.0617美元，周四上涨0.49%。单一货币预计每周上涨 0.5%。

The Japanese yen was 150.41 per dollar, keeping traders nervy and looking for signs of intervention from Japanese authorities.翻译:日元兑美元汇率为 150.41，这让交易员感到紧张，并寻找日本当局干预的迹象。

The yen has had a whirlwind week, touching a one-year low against the dollar and 15-year low against the euro on Tuesday after the Bank of Japan tweaked its yield curve control policy.翻译:在日本央行调整收益率曲线控制政策后，日元经历了旋风般的一周，兑美元触及一年低点，兑欧元触及15年低点。

Kazuo Ueda, the central bank's governor, will continue to dismantle its ultra-loose monetary policy and look to exit the decade-long accommodative regime next year, Reuters reported on Thursday.翻译:据路透社周四报道，日本央行行长上田一夫将继续取消超宽松货币政策，并寻求明年退出长达十年的宽松政策。

Ueda's intentions are based on interviews with six sources familiar with the BOJ's thinking, including government officials with direct interaction with the bank.翻译:上田的意图是基于对六名熟悉日本央行想法的消息人士的采访，其中包括与该行直接互动的政府官员。

Sterling was trading at $1.2189, down 0.10% on the day, having risen 0.4%, and was on course for a 0.5% weekly gain. The Bank of England joined other major central banks in holding rates steady and stressed that it did not expect to start cutting them any time soon.翻译:英镑交易价格为1.2189美元，当天下跌0.10%，此前上涨0.4%，并有望每周上涨0.5%。英国央行与其他主要央行一样保持利率稳定，并强调预计不会很快开始降息。

The Australian dollar eased 0.19% to $0.642, while the New Zealand dollar fell 0.24% to $0.588.翻译:澳元兑美元下跌0.19%，至0.642美元；新西兰元兑美元下跌0.24%，至0.588美元。

Reporting by Ankur Banerjee and Rae Wee in Singapore. Editing by Gerry Doyle翻译:Ankur Banerjee 和 Rae Wee 在新加坡的报道。格里·多伊尔编辑

item.title: 苹果告诉投资者，华为威胁迫在眉睫，中国 iPhone 销量强劲
item.description:
Apple (AAPL.O) said on Thursday that demand for its iPhones in China was strong, trying to reassure investors who are worried it is losing ground to a newly resurgent Huawei Technologies [RIC:RIC:HWT.UL] and other local smartphone makers.翻译:苹果(AAPL.O)周四表示， 中国对其 iPhone 的需求强劲，试图安抚那些担心苹果正在输给新崛起的华为技术公司 [RIC:RIC:HWT.UL] 和其他本土智能手机制造商的投资者。 。

"In mainland China, we set a quarterly record for the September quarter for iPhone," Chief Executive Tim Cook told Reuters in an interview. "We had four out of the top five best-selling smartphones in urban China."翻译:首席执行官蒂姆·库克在接受路透社采访时表示：“在中国大陆，我们创下了 iPhone 9 月份季度的季度记录。” “中国城市最畅销的智能手机前五名中，我们占了四席。”

Apple appeared to have gained market share in China in the July-September period, even if the overall smartphone market may have contracted, he said on a conference call with analysts.翻译:他在与分析师的电话会议上表示，尽管整个智能手机市场可能出现萎缩，但苹果公司似乎在 7 月至 9 月期间在中国获得了市场份额。

The company expects to sell more iPhones in the holiday quarter despite this year's quarter having one fewer week of sales than the prior year's, Cook said.翻译:库克表示，尽管今年季度的销量比去年同期少了一周，但该公司预计将在假日季度销售更多 iPhone。

Research firm Canalys estimated that overall smartphone sales in China fell 3% in July-September from a year earlier as consumers bought fewer smartphones as an economic recovery was choppy.翻译:研究公司 Canalys 估计，7 月至 9 月中国智能手机整体销量同比下降 3%，原因是经济复苏之路崎岖，消费者购买的智能手机减少。

That was slower pace of decline than previous quarters, a sign that a slump in the market had eased. Sales of iPhones in China fell 6%, Canalys said.翻译:下降速度比前几个季度要慢，这表明市场的下滑已经有所缓解。 Canalys 表示，iPhone 在中国的销量下降了 6%。

On the other hand, analysts estimate that Huawei's China smartphone sales grew strongly in the quarter. Its Mate 60 Pro phone has grabbed headlines for using an advanced China-made chip despite being squeezed for years by debilitating U.S. sanctions.翻译:另一方面，分析师估计华为在中国的智能手机销量本季度强劲增长。尽管多年来受到美国制裁的挤压，其 Mate 60 Pro 手机仍因使用先进的中国制造芯片而成为头条新闻。

Apple said on Thursday that its overall sales in China dipped 2.5% but it blamed tough Mac computer and iPad sales for that. Cook said sales there grew after accounting for foreign-exchange rates.翻译:苹果周四表示，其在中国的整体销量下降了 2.5%，但将其归咎于 Mac 电脑和 iPad 的销售疲软。库克表示，考虑到汇率因素后，该地区的销售额有所增长。

Apple's sales in China have fallen in three of the four quarters in its 2023 fiscal year, which ended Sept. 30.翻译:截至 9 月 30 日的 2023 财年，苹果在中国的销售额有四个季度出现下滑。

Apple's comments followed optimistic commentary from its chip supplier Qualcomm (QCOM.O) on Wednesday, which signaled that a two-year-long slump in the smartphone market was easing, led by a recovery in China.翻译:苹果公司发表上述言论之前，其芯片供应商高通公司(QCOM.O)周三发表了乐观评论，这表明智能手机市场长达两年的低迷在中国复苏的带动下正在缓解。

Qorvo (QRVO.O), another wireless connectivity chip supplier to Apple, also said inventory levels at their China customers were slowly falling and that the company had recorded its largest bookings quarter in more than two years.翻译:苹果的另一家无线连接芯片供应商Qorvo (QRVO.O)也表示，其中国客户的库存水平正在缓慢下降，该公司创下了两年多以来最大的预订季度记录。

Both chipmakers posted upbeat forecasts, with Qualcomm predicting a 35% quarter-on-quarter rise in sales to Chinese smartphone customers.翻译:两家芯片制造商都发布了乐观的预测，高通预计中国智能手机客户的销售额将环比增长 35%。

Qualcomm is also facing new competition from Huawei's chips, but said on Wednesday it does not expect Huawei's re-entry into the market to affect its relationship with Chinese smartphone companies.翻译:高通还面临来自华为芯片的新竞争，但周三表示，预计华为重新进入市场不会影响其与中国智能手机公司的关系。

Reporting by Yuvraj Malik in Bengaluru and Stephen Nellis in San Francisco, additional reporting by Arsheeya Bajwa and Harshita Varghese in Bengaluru; Writing by Sayantani Ghosh. item.title: 英国首相苏纳克：新人工智能模型将在发布前进行测试
item.description:
British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Thursday said that like-minded governments and artificial intelligence companies had reached agreement on testing new AI models before they were released.翻译:英国首相里希·苏纳克周四表示，志同道合的政府和人工智能公司已就新人工智能模型发布前的测试达成一致。

Sunak is hosting a two-day AI Safety Summit where on Wednesday he secured China's backing for an international effort to manage the risks of the technology.翻译:苏纳克正在主办为期两天的人工智能安全峰会，周三他在峰会上获得了中国对管理该技术风险的国际努力的支持。

On Thursday, Sunak announced a further "landmark agreement" with "like-minded governments and AI companies."翻译:周四，苏纳克宣布与“志同道合的政府和人工智能公司”达成进一步的“里程碑式协议”。

"We will work together on testing the safety of new AI models before they are released," Sunak said at a press conference at the summit.翻译:苏纳克在峰会新闻发布会上表示：“我们将在新人工智能模型发布之前共同测试其安全性。”

A list of the countries that had signed up to the safety testing collaboration did not include China, whose representatives were not included in the second day of talks.翻译:签署安全测试合作的国家名单中不包括中国，中国的代表也没有参加第二天的会谈。

Representatives from the United States, European Union, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, South Korea, Singapore, Canada and Australia were involved in the talks.翻译:来自美国、欧盟、法国、德国、意大利、日本、韩国、新加坡、加拿大和澳大利亚的代表参加了会谈。

"It is critical that frontier AI is developed safely and that the potential risks of new models are rigorously assessed before and after they are deployed, including by evaluating for potentially harmful capabilities," Britain said in a chair's statement summary of the participants' discussions.翻译:英国在与会者讨论的主席声明摘要中表示：“安全开发前沿人工智能，并在部署新模型之前和之后对其潜在风险进行严格评估，包括评估潜在有害能力，这一点至关重要。”

Asked why China had not been invited to discuss AI model testing, Sunak said it had been right to invite China to some parts of the summit, in line with Britain's policy to engage with China where possible but also protect against risks.翻译:当被问及为什么没有邀请中国讨论人工智能模型测试时，苏纳克表示，邀请中国参加峰会的某些部分是正确的，这符合英国在可能的情况下与中国接触但也要防范风险的政策。

"We achieved the outcome that we wanted, which was for them to be here, to be engaged ... and for them to have signed up to the Bletchley Park communique," he said.翻译:“我们实现了我们想要的结果，那就是让他们来到这里，参与进来……并让他们签署布莱奇利公园公报，”他说。

Reporting by Paul Sandle, Martin Coulter and William James, writing by Alistair Smout翻译:保罗·桑德尔、马丁·库尔特和威廉·詹姆斯报道，阿利斯泰尔·斯莫特撰稿

item.title: 菲律宾指责中国侵入其海域
item.description:
The Philippine foreign ministry on Thursday accused China of intruding into its waters after an incident involving the two countries' military vessels at a disputed shoal in the South China Sea earlier this week.翻译:本周早些时候，两国军舰在南海争议浅滩发生事件，菲律宾外交部周四指责中国侵入菲律宾海域。

The Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) said the Chinese military's claim that a Philippine military ship "illegally entered" waters near the Scarborough Shoal "has no legal basis and only serves to raise tensions" in the disputed waterway.翻译:外交部表示，中国军方关于菲律宾军舰“非法进入”黄岩岛附近海域的说法“没有法律依据，只会加剧争议航道的紧张局势”。

"It is China that is intruding into Philippine waters," the foreign ministry said in a statement.翻译:外交部在一份声明中表示：“是中国入侵了菲律宾海域。”

The Philippines and China both lay claim to the Scarborough Shoal but sovereignty has never been established and it remains effectively under Beijing's control since it seized it from Manila in 2012.翻译:菲律宾和中国都声称对黄岩岛拥有主权，但主权从未确立，自2012年从马尼拉手中夺取黄岩岛以来，黄岩岛实际上仍处于北京的控制之下。

The DFA said the shoal, which it calls "Bajo de Masinloc", is within the Philippines' exclusive economic zone and the country has sovereign rights and jurisdiction over it.翻译:外交部表示，该浅滩被称为“Bajo de Masinloc”，位于菲律宾专属经济区内，菲律宾对其拥有主权权利和管辖权。

"The Philippines has consistently demanded that Chinese vessels in Bajo de Masinloc leave the area immediately," the foreign ministry said.翻译:菲律宾外交部表示：“菲律宾一贯要求在巴霍德马辛洛克的中国船只立即离开该地区。”

The shoal, located 200 km (124 miles) off the Philippines, was part of an arbitration claim filed by Manila at an international tribunal. The court ruled in 2016 that Beijing's claim to 90% of the South China Sea had no basis under international law, but China has refused to recognise the ruling.翻译:该浅滩距离菲律宾 200 公里（124 英里），是马尼拉向国际法庭提出的仲裁索赔的一部分。该法院于2016年裁定，北京对南海90%海域的主权主张没有国际法依据，但中国拒绝承认这一裁决。

The Philippines presidential office said Thursday South China Sea matters will be part of the bilateral talks between Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and President Ferdinand Marcos on Friday. Kishida is set to arrive in Manila on Friday for a two-day visit.翻译:菲律宾总统办公室周四表示，南海问题将成为日本首相岸田文雄和总统费迪南德·马科斯周五双边会谈的一部分。岸田定于周五抵达马尼拉进行为期两天的访问。

Ahead of the visit, the Japan defence ministry also announced the delivery of the first air surveillance radar system to the Philippine military as part of a 2020 contract between the Philippines' defence department and Mitsubishi Electric Corp.翻译:在访问之前，日本防卫省还宣布向菲律宾军方交付首个空中监视雷达系统，作为菲律宾国防部与三菱电机公司之间 2020 年合同的一部分。

Reporting by Mikhail Flores; Editing by Kanupriya Kapoor and Miral Fahmy翻译:米哈伊尔·弗洛雷斯报道；编辑：Kanupriya Kapoor 和 Miral Fahmy
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 中国火葬“人民”总理并在悲痛中降下国旗
item.description:
China lowered the national flag Beijing's Tiananmen Square on Thursday amid an outpouring of online grief as the country cremated Li Keqiang, known as "the people's premier" for his down-to-earth, hands-on leadership.翻译:周四，中国在北京天安门广场降下国旗，火化了因其脚踏实地、亲力亲为的领导而被称为“人民总理”的李克强，网上一片悲痛。

Li, a former economist and pro-reform leader who served as premier for 10 years before retiring in March, died of a heart attack in Shanghai last Friday. He was 68.翻译:李克强是一位前经济学家和支持改革的领导人，曾担任总理十年，于今年三月退休，上周五在上海因心脏病去世。他 68 岁了。

At Li's funeral at a Beijing cemetery where high-ranking officials and national heroes are laid to rest, President Xi Jinping and his wife, with the six other members of the Communist Party's Politburo Standing Committee, the highest rung of political power in China, as well as Vice President Han Zheng paid their final respects.翻译:李克强的葬礼在北京一座高官和民族英雄的墓地举行，国家主席习近平和他的妻子，以及中共中央政治局常务委员会的其他六名成员，是中国最高政治权力机构。韩正副院长致以最后的哀悼。

The group stood in silence and took three bows, the official Xinhua news agency reported.翻译:据官方新华社报道，这群人默哀并三鞠躬。

Former President Hu Jintao sent a wreath to express his condolences over Li's passing, according to Xinhua.翻译:据新华社报道，国家主席胡锦涛向李克强逝世致以花圈表示哀悼。

Messages for the late premier flooded social media platforms as Chinese citizens mourned his death.翻译:随着中国公民哀悼已故总理的去世，社交媒体平台上充斥着给他的留言。

On popular social media platform Weibo, which replaced its 'like' button with a chrysanthemum flower symbolising mourning on related posts, tens of thousands of people left comments bidding Li farewell on a Thursday post by China's national broadcaster.翻译:在流行的社交媒体平台微博上，相关帖子中的“点赞”按钮被象征哀悼的菊花取代，数以万计的人在中国国家广播公司周四发布的帖子中发表了告别李的评论。

Li was the top trending topic on Weibo. The hashtag for his mourning drew 430 million views.翻译:李成为微博上的热门话题。哀悼他的标签吸引了 4.3 亿次浏览。

A Beijinger surnamed Gao said Li will be remembered for his contributions to the nation. "It can be said that he has made a great contribution to people's lives, to the improvement of living standards. In the recent pandemic, the premier always rushed to the front line," Gao said.翻译:一位高姓北京人表示，李先生对国家的贡献将被人们铭记。 “可以说，他为人民生活、为人民生活水平的提高做出了巨大贡献。在最近的疫情中，总理总是冲在第一线。”高说。

Once viewed as a Communist Party leadership contender, Li was sidelined in recent years, analysts and diplomats said, as Xi tightened his grip on economic policymaking.翻译:分析人士和外交官表示，随着习近平加强对经济政策制定的控制，李克强一度被视为共产党领导层的有力竞争者，但近年来却被边缘化。

Shanghai resident Zhang Shijun described Li as down-to-earth man who "lot for our people; very humble and low-key".翻译:上海居民张世军形容李是一个脚踏实地的人，“为人民谋福利，非常谦虚和低调”。

Some businesses such as international coffee chain Starbucks (SBUX.O) turned their app interface black and white in mourning for Li.翻译:国际咖啡连锁店星巴克（SBUX.O）等一些企业将其应用程序界面变成黑白，以哀悼李。

Photographs of Li were shared on Weibo by Xinhua news agency, including those of him with Xi, Hu and former leader Jiang Zemin. There were also photographs of Li interacting with ordinary Chinese people in the 2000s as well as one of him clambering over rubble in a disaster-stricken zone after a major earthquake in Sichuan in southwest China.翻译:新华社在微博上分享了李克强的照片，其中包括他与习近平、胡锦涛和前领导人江泽民的照片。还有李在2000年代与普通中国人互动的照片，以及他在中国西南部四川发生大地震后在灾区废墟上攀爬的照片。

"It still feels a bit unreal, because I feel like he's a good premier and suddenly he's gone," said a 24-year-old Beijing-based lawyer surnamed Wan. "And then I also feel sad for him because he was not yet old."翻译:“这还是感觉有点不真实，因为我觉得他是一个很好的总理，突然他就走了，”一位24岁的北京万姓律师说。 “然后我也为他感到难过，因为他还没有老。”

Reporting by Liz Lee, Xiaoyu Yin, Ryan Woo and Beijing newsroom; Editing by Christian Schmollinger and Shri Navaratnam and Miral Fahmy翻译:Liz Lee、Xiaoyu Yin、Ryan Woo 和北京新闻编辑室报道；编辑：Christian Schmollinger、Shri Navaratnam 和 Miral Fahmy

item.title: 耶伦：印太盟友不应在美国和中国之间做出选择
item.description:
U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Thursday sought to reassure Asian countries that the U.S. approach to China would not lead to a 'disastrous' division of the global economy that would force them to take sides.翻译:美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦周四试图向亚洲国家保证，美国对华政策不会导致全球经济出现“灾难性”分裂，从而迫使它们选边站队。

In a speech ahead of the U.S.-hosted Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation Summit in San Francisco later this month, Yellen said that a full de-coupling of the U.S. and Chinese economies was "simply not practical," especially given the complexity of Asian supply chains and the region's deep economic ties to China.翻译:耶伦本月晚些时候在旧金山举行的亚太经济合作峰会之前发表演讲时表示，美国和中国经济完全脱钩“根本不切实际”，特别是考虑到亚洲供应链的复杂性以及该地区与中国的深厚经济联系。

Her comments sought to assuage growing concerns about geopolitical fragmentation of the global economy into U.S.-led and China-led factions amid growing national security-driven export and technology controls between the world's two largest economies.翻译:她的言论试图缓解人们对全球经济地缘政治分裂为美国主导和中国主导的派系日益增长的担忧，因为全球最大的两个经济体之间以国家安全为导向的出口和技术控制日益加强。

"A full separation of our economies, or an approach in which countries including those in the Indo-Pacific are forced to take sides, would have significant negative global repercussions," Yellen said. "We have no interest in such a divided world and its disastrous effects."翻译:耶伦表示：“我们经济的全面分离，或者包括印太地区国家在内的国家被迫选边站队的做法，将会对全球产生重大的负面影响。” “我们对这样一个分裂的世界及其灾难性影响不感兴趣。”

Yellen said the U.S. instead was pursuing the "de-risking and diversifying" of its economic ties to China, by investing in manufacturing at home and by strengthening linkages with allies and partners around the world, including Indo-Pacific countries.翻译:耶伦表示，美国正在通过投资国内制造业以及加强与包括印太国家在内的世界各地盟友和伙伴的联系，寻求与中国的经济关系“去风险化和多元化”。

Yellen said the U.S. would not compromise on national security actions, but aimed to keep them narrowly targeted, not for the purpose of "choking off growth in China."翻译:耶伦表示，美国不会在国家安全行动上妥协，但旨在将其目标锁定在狭隘范围内，而不是为了“遏制中国的增长”。

Her remarks to an Asia Society event came as the U.S. is preparing to host leaders and other top officials from APEC countries in San Francisco from Nov. 11-17. The White House wants to schedule a meeting between U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping alongside the summit.翻译:她在亚洲协会活动上发表上述言论之际，美国正准备于 11 月 11 日至 17 日在旧金山接待亚太经合组织国家的领导人和其他高级官员。白宫希望在峰会期间安排美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平举行会晤。

TRADE, INVESTMENT LINKS

Yellen said the Biden administration was committed to expanding trade and investment with Indo-Pacific countries, emphasizing the region's strategic importance ahead of the APEC gathering.翻译:耶伦表示，拜登政府致力于扩大与印太国家的贸易和投资，并在亚太经合组织会议之前强调了该地区的战略重要性。

Deeper economic links with Indo-Pacific countries will help make U.S. supply chains more resilient and tap into a dynamic and growing market for U.S. exports, she said.翻译:她表示，与印太国家加深经济联系将有助于增强美国供应链的弹性，并进入充满活力且不断增长的美国出口市场。

"As we look toward APEC later this month, let me state unequivocally: Claims that America is turning away from the Indo-Pacific are wholly unfounded," Yellen said in the excerpts. "We are deepening our economic ties across the region, with tremendous potential benefits for the U.S. economy and for the Indo-Pacific."翻译:耶伦在摘录中表示：“当我们展望本月晚些时候的亚太经合组织时，让我明确指出：有关美国正在远离印太地区的说法完全没有根据。” “我们正在深化整个地区的经济联系，这将为美国经济和印度-太平洋地区带来巨大的潜在利益。”

The Biden administration also has called a seventh negotiating round for its Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity (IPEF) initiative next week in San Francisco, aimed at reaching some agreements in time for the APEC summit.翻译:拜登政府还呼吁下周在旧金山举行印太经济繁荣框架（IPEF）倡议第七轮谈判，旨在在亚太经合组织峰会前及时达成一些协议。

IPEF, while far short of a traditional free trade agreement, is the Biden administration's signature initiative to engage economically with Asian countries and provide them a trade and investment alternative to China.翻译:IPEF虽然远非传统的自由贸易协定，但却是拜登政府与亚洲国家进行经济接触并为它们提供中国以外的贸易和投资替代方案的标志性倡议。

Yellen said deeper integration with Indo-Pacific countries would benefit the region and the U.S. She noted that U.S. two-way trade with the region reached a value of $2.28 trillion in 2022, up 25% since 2019, with the region taking nearly a quarter of U.S. exports.翻译:耶伦表示，与印太国家深化一体化将使该地区和美国受益。她指出，美国与该地区的双向贸易额到2022年将达到2.28万亿美元，自2019年以来增长25%，其中该地区占据了近四分之一的贸易额。美国出口。

"The economic case for our expanding trade and investment is clear. The Indo-Pacific is a dynamic and rapidly growing region. As it grows, we gain a fast-expanding customer base for U.S. firms and workers," Yellen said.翻译:“我们扩大贸易和投资的经济理由是明确的。印太地区是一个充满活力且快速增长的地区。随着它的发展，我们为美国公司和工人赢得了快速扩大的客户群，”耶伦说。

SUPPLY CHAIN SECURITY

Part of the reason for increased trade with the region has been the migration of U.S. supply chains away from China, a trend that started with tariffs imposed by former President Donald Trump in 2018 and accelerated since the COVID-19 pandemic.翻译:与该地区贸易增加的部分原因是美国供应链从中国迁移，这一趋势始于前总统唐纳德·特朗普在 2018 年征收关税，并自 COVID-19 大流行以来加速。

Yellen said economic engagement with Indo-Pacific countries, including Vietnam, is "crucial to bolstering our supply chain security" to avoid bottlenecks and shortages that occurred as the world emerged from the pandemic. She repeated her desire to diversify supply chains to countries in the region through "friend-shoring" or using trusted allies as sources of supply.翻译:耶伦表示，与包括越南在内的印太国家的经济接触“对于加强我们的供应链安全至关重要”，以避免世界摆脱疫情后出现的瓶颈和短缺。她重申希望通过“友邦”或使用值得信赖的盟友作为供应来源，使该地区国家的供应链多样化。

"And achieving resilience through partnering with Indo-Pacific countries means gains for Indo-Pacific economies as well," Yellen said.翻译:耶伦表示：“通过与印太国家合作实现韧性也意味着印太经济体的收益。”

Reporting by David Lawder;editing by Diane Craft翻译:大卫·劳德 (David Lawder) 报道；黛安·克拉夫特 (Diane Craft) 编辑

item.title: 尽管存在其他全球挑战，美国仍将重点放在印度太平洋地区——官员们
item.description:
The United States remains focused on the Indo-Pacific despite other global challenges, top U.S. diplomats said on Thursday as Secretary of State Antony Blinken prepared to go to Asia after a Middle East trip amid the Israel-Hamas conflict.翻译:美国高级外交官周四表示，尽管面临其他全球挑战，美国仍将重点放在印度-太平洋地区，国务卿安东尼·布林肯在以色列与哈马斯冲突期间结束中东之行后准备前往亚洲。

Blinken heads to Israel this week for talks on the Middle East conflict and will stop in Jordan before heading to Japan for a meeting with G7 counterparts and bilateral talks with Japanese officials and stops in South Korea and India. The trip lasts until Nov. 10.翻译:布林肯本周将前往以色列就中东冲突举行会谈，并在约旦停留，然后前往日本与七国集团同行举行会议，并与日本官员举行双边会谈，并在韩国和印度停留。行程持续至11月10日。

"The Secretary's trip to the region demonstrates our enduring commitment to and focus on the Indo-Pacific, even amidst other global challenges," the top U.S. diplomat for East Asia, Daniel Kritenbrink, told reporters in previewing the Asia leg of the trip.翻译:美国负责东亚事务的最高外交官丹尼尔·克里滕布林克(Daniel Kritenbrink)在预览此次亚洲之行时对记者表示：“国务卿的该地区之行表明了我们对印太地区的持久承诺和关注，即使面临其他全球挑战。”

Kritenbrink said Blinken would attend a meeting of G7 foreign ministers in Tokyo and have separate talks with Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and Foreign Minster Yoko Kamikawa.翻译:克里滕布林克表示，布林肯将出席在东京举行的七国集团外长会议，并分别与日本首相岸田文雄和外相上川洋子举行会谈。

"We anticipate that discussions in those meetings will focus on events in the Middle East, support for Ukraine, cooperation in the Indo-Pacific, a range of bilateral issues and of course, trilateral cooperation as well with (South Korea)," he said.翻译:他说：“我们预计这些会议的讨论将集中在中东事件、对乌克兰的支持、印度-太平洋地区的合作、一系列双边问题，当然还有与（韩国）的三边合作。” 。

Kritenbrink said Japan had been an "outstanding" G7 chair and had "kept the G7 laser-focused on the most pressing issues both globally and regionally."翻译:克里滕布林克表示，日本一直是七国集团的“杰出”主席国，并且“让七国集团始终专注于全球和地区最紧迫的问题”。

He did not respond when asked if he was confident the G7 would be able to agree a robust statement on the Israel-Hamas conflict.翻译:当被问及是否有信心七国集团能够就以色列与哈马斯冲突达成强有力的声明时，他没有回应。

Asked what Blinken would tell the Asian countries about his talks last week with Chinese Foreign Minster Wang Yi, Kritenbrink said he believed they wanted to see Washington "responsibly managing our competition with China."翻译:当被问及布林肯将向亚洲国家介绍他上周与中国外交部长王毅的会谈时，克里滕布林克表示，他相信他们希望看到华盛顿“负责任地管理我们与中国的竞争”。

"Our commitment to the Indo-Pacific remains enduring," he said. "And the fundamental focus of our diplomacy in the Indo-Pacific remains strengthening our ties with allies, partners and friends, and growing their collective capacity, our shared capacity to support the rules-based international order."翻译:“我们对印度-太平洋地区的承诺仍然持久，”他说。 “我们在印太地区外交的根本重点仍然是加强我们与盟友、伙伴和朋友的关系，并增强他们的集体能力，即我们支持基于规则的国际秩序的共同能力。”

The top U.S. diplomat for South Asia, Donald Wu, said "efforts to advance democracy and human rights" would be on the agenda in talks between the U.S. and Indian foreign and defense ministers "as well as our expanded cooperation in clean energy, counterterrorism, artificial intelligence, space, and semiconductor manufacturing."翻译:美国负责南亚事务的高级外交官唐纳德·吴表示，“推进民主和人权的努力”将列入美国和印度外交部长和国防部长之间会谈的议程，“以及我们在清洁能源、反恐、人工智能、太空和半导体制造。”

item.title: 出于安全和权利担忧，香港举办同性恋运动会首届亚洲站
item.description:
Hong Kong will be the first Asian city to hold the Gay Games from Friday, co-hosting them with a Mexican city in one of the financial hub's biggest events since COVID-19, despite ban calls from rights activists and lawmakers opposing LGBTQ efforts.翻译:尽管权利活动人士和立法者呼吁禁止 LGBTQ 活动，但香港将从周五起成为第一个举办同性恋运动会的亚洲城市，与墨西哥城市共同主办这一金融中心自 COVID-19 以来最大的活动之一。

The Chinese-ruled city has no law against discrimination based on sexual orientation and does not recognise same-sex marriage, but its LGBTQ community has scored some legal wins this year.翻译:这个中国统治的城市没有针对性取向歧视的法律，也不承认同性婚姻，但 LGBTQ 群体今年取得了一些法律胜利。

The most significant was a September ruling by its top court that set a two-year deadline for the government to establish a legal framework to recognise same-sex unions.翻译:最重要的是最高法院九月份的一项裁决，规定政府在两年内建立承认同性婚姻的法律框架。

More than 2,300 athletes from 45 countries, including Britain, China, South Korea and the United States, are expected to participate, the organisers, the Gay Games Hong Kong (GGHK) said.翻译:主办方香港同性恋运动会（GGHK）表示，预计将有来自英国、中国、韩国和美国等 45 个国家的 2,300 多名运动员参加。

"Not only have we been able to introduce the games to the region, we have the highest number of participants ever from Asia join the Gay Games in its 41-year history," Alan Lang, the body's co-chair, told a press conference on Thursday.翻译:该机构联合主席艾伦·朗 (Alan Lang) 在新闻发布会上表示：“我们不仅能够将同性恋运动会引入该地区，而且我们的同性恋运动会 41 年历史上参加人数是有史以来最多的。”星期四。

The government in the former British colony has approved the Gay Games, which run until Nov. 11, but advised organisers to follow laws and regulations in a "safe and orderly manner"."Our aim is not to advocate for any specific political or legislative changes but to provide a platform for sports, arts, and culture that promotes inclusivity and diversity," the games' organising committee said this week.翻译:这个前英国殖民地政府已批准举办同性恋运动会，该运动会持续到11月11日，但建议组织者以“安全有序的方式”遵守法律法规。“我们的目的不是提倡任何具体的政治或立法奥运会组委会本周表示，“这些改变只是为了为体育、艺术和文化提供一个促进包容性和多样性的平台。”

Among the sports and cultural events to feature are some of Chinese origin, such as dragon boat racing and mahjong, while a new trail running event is to be held on mountainous Lantau island.翻译:体育和文化活动中包括一些起源于中国的活动，如龙舟赛和麻将，而一项新的越野跑活动将在山区的大屿山举行。

Worries about the national security law Beijing recently clamped on Hong Kong will keep Taiwan's delegation away, however.翻译:然而，对北京最近对香港实施的国家安全法的担忧将使台湾代表团望而却步。

"The main reason ... this time is that the safety of Taiwanese players cannot be guaranteed," said Yang Chih-chun, of Taiwan's Gay Sports and Movement Association, adding that it had been "a painful decision" not to send the athletes.翻译:台湾同性恋运动运动协会的杨志春说：“这次的主要原因是台湾运动员的安全无法得到保障。”他补充说，不派运动员参加是“一个痛苦的决定” 。

Taiwan's athletes will go instead to Mexico's western city of Guadalajara, which is co-hosting the games at the same time.翻译:台湾运动员将前往同时主办奥运会的墨西哥西部城市瓜达拉哈拉。

Several Hong Kong lawmakers have voiced public opposition to the event, saying it posed threats to national security threats, subverted traditional Chinese family values and followed a "western ideology".翻译:多名香港立法会议员公开反对这一活动，称其对国家安全构成威胁、颠覆中国传统家庭价值观并追随“西方意识形态”。

Five Hong Kong human rights activists also called for the games to be cancelled, saying the organisers "aligned themselves with pro-authoritarian figures responsible for widespread persecution" in Hong Kong.翻译:五名香港人权活动人士也呼吁取消奥运会，称组织者“与对香港广泛迫害负有责任的亲独裁人士结盟”。

"We've always respected the law and followed the law... We hope that all of our participants will follow Hong Kong's laws and culture," GGHK's co-chair Lisa Lam said on Thursday.翻译:“我们一直尊重法律并遵守法律……我们希望所有参与者都遵守香港的法律和文化，”GGHK联合主席林丽莎周四表示。

Many events are to be held at private venues, universities or schools, with the opening and closing functions scheduled in a stadium in the busy commercial district of Wan Chai.翻译:许多活动将在私人场地、大学或学校举行，开幕式和闭幕式均安排在湾仔繁忙商业区的体育场举行。

Beijing's national security law, imposed in 2020 after months of anti-government protests, punishes acts such as subversion, collusion with foreign forces and terrorism with terms of up to life in prison.翻译:经过数月的反政府抗议后，北京于 2020 年实施了国家安全法，对颠覆、勾结外国势力和恐怖主义等行为最高可判处无期徒刑。

Hong Kong and mainland China have said the security law has brought stability after the 2019 protests.翻译:香港和中国内地均表示，国安法在 2019 年抗议活动后带来了稳定。

Reporting by Jessie Pang; Editing by Farah Master and Clarence Fernandez翻译:彭杰西报道；法拉·马斯特和克拉伦斯·费尔南德斯编辑

item.title: 美国农场领导人访华谈农业贸易
item.description:
Dozens of U.S. agriculture industry representatives gathered in Beijing on Thursday to meet Chinese counterparts amid growing U.S. efforts to bolster farm trade even as political ties between their two countries remain strained.翻译:尽管两国之间的政治关系仍然紧张，但美国仍在加大力度促进农产品贸易，数十名美国农业行业代表周四齐聚北京，与中国同行会面。

A delegation from 11 groups including the U.S. Soybean Export Council, U.S. Grains Council and U.S. Wheat Associates is visiting a week after Chinese grain buyers signed non-binding agreements in Iowa to buy billions of dollars worth of produce, mostly soybeans, the first such signing since 2017.翻译:一周前，来自美国大豆出口委员会、美国谷物委员会和美国小麦协会等 11 个团体的代表团来访，此前一周，中国谷物买家在爱荷华州签署了购买价值数十亿美元农产品（主要是大豆）的非约束性协议，这是首次签署此类协议自2017年以来。

This week's visit, the likes of which had become rare due to bilateral tensions and three years of Chinese COVID-19 border controls, comes ahead of an expected meeting between President Xi Jinping and President Joe Biden in San Francisco this month.翻译:本周的访问是在习近平主席和乔·拜登总统预计本月在旧金山举行会晤之前进行的，由于双边紧张局势和中国对新冠病毒（COVID-19）实施了三年的边境管制，此类访问已经变得罕见。

"We've got a big complicated relationship, but agriculture is the ballast in the relationship," Nicholas Burns, U.S. ambassador to China, told the gathering of U.S. and Chinese industry officials.翻译:“我们之间的关系非常复杂，但农业是这种关系的压舱石，”美国驻华大使尼古拉斯·伯恩斯(Nicholas Burns)在美国和中国工业官员聚会上表示。

U.S. Grains Council officials visited China's commerce ministry earlier on Thursday and raised China's anti-dumping and anti-subsidy measures against U.S. imports of distillers dried grains (DDGS), a protein-rich byproduct from ethanol production that is fed to animals.翻译:美国谷物委员会官员周四早些时候访问了中国商务部，提出了中国对美国进口的干酒糟（DDGS）采取的反倾销和反补贴措施，DDGS是一种富含蛋白质的乙醇生产副产品，用于喂养动物。

"They suggested we talk with the domestic industry here to have them give their support in the need of the product and they brought up the fact that they'd recently dropped the anti-dumping case on Australian barley, so whether that shows some hope for U.S. DDGs, possibly. I'm not sure," said Cary Sifferath, vice president of the U.S. Grains Council.翻译:“他们建议我们与国内行业进行对话，让他们对产品的需求提供支持，他们提出了最近撤销了对澳大利亚大麦的反倾销案的事实，所以这是否表明了一些希望美国谷物委员会副主席 Cary Sifferath 表示：“可能是美国 DDG。我不确定。”

Oilseeds and grains are the top U.S. export to China, accounting for $25.4 billion last year, far ahead of other goods such as semiconductors, but Brazil has been eating into the U.S. share of the Chinese market after harvesting bumper crops of soybeans and corn.翻译:油籽和谷物是美国对华出口的最大产品，去年出口额达254亿美元，远远领先于半导体等其他商品，但巴西在收获大豆和玉米丰收后，一直在蚕食美国在中国市场的份额。

China has been pushing to diversify its import sources in the years since former U.S. President Donald Trump launched a bruising trade war and amid rising geopolitical risks, opening its market to Brazilian corn late last year.翻译:自美国前总统唐纳德·特朗普发动激烈的贸易战以来，在地缘政治风险不断上升的情况下，中国去年年底向巴西玉米开放市场，多年来一直在努力实现进口来源多元化。

Imports of Brazilian soybeans are up 18% in the first nine months of 2023 compared with the same period last year, compared with an 8% increase in U.S. arrivals. Almost 4 million tons of Brazilian corn has reached China, with more on the way.翻译:2023 年前 9 个月，巴西大豆进口量较去年同期增长 18%，而美国大豆进口量增长 8%。近 400 万吨巴西玉米已运抵中国，还有更多正在运抵中国。

The delegation, the industry's largest to China since 2016, will travel to Shanghai for next week's annual China International Import Expo, where the USDA is hosting a pavilion for the first time since the event started in 2018.翻译:这是该行业自 2016 年以来最大规模的中国代表团，将前往上海参加下周举行的一年一度的中国国际进口博览会，这是美国农业部自 2018 年举办该博览会以来首次在此设立展馆。

(This story has been refiled to fix the spelling of 'semiconductors' in paragraph 7)翻译:（这个故事已被重新归档，以修正第 7 段中“半导体”的拼写）

item.title: 中国监管机构调查导致利率创纪录50%的流动性压力——消息人士
item.description:
China's financial regulators are investigating a month-end liquidity crunch that saw short-term money rates surge to as much as 50%, asking some institutions to explain why they borrowed at extremely high rates, three sources said.翻译:三名消息人士称，中国金融监管机构正在调查月底的流动性紧缩，导致短期货币利率飙升至 50%，并要求一些机构解释为何以极高的利率借款。

The overnight rate for pledged repo - a short-term financing business - hit a record high of 50% on Oct 31, as a month-end scramble for cash and a flood of government bond sales caused stress in money markets.翻译:10月31日，质押式回购（一种短期融资业务）隔夜利率创下50%的历史新高，原因是月底现金争夺战和大量国债销售给货币市场带来压力。

The China Foreign Exchange Trade System (CFETS), a central bank affiliate that operates China's interbank market, has asked institutions that settled trades on Tuesday at the 50% rate to submit explanations, according two sources with direct knowledge.翻译:据两位直接知情人士透露，负责运营中国银行间市场的央行附属机构中国外汇交易中心（CFETS）已要求周二以 50% 利率进行交易结算的机构提交解释。

"Anyone who borrowed money at very high rates need to explain to regulators the decision-making and bidding process," said another direct source.翻译:另一位直接消息人士表示：“任何以极高利率借钱的人都需要向监管机构解释决策和招标过程。”

Traders and analysts said an increasing supply of government bonds, and newly approved 1-trillion-yuan ($136.63 billion) sovereign bond issue created unusual liquidity stress at a time when banks need to square their books to meet month-end regulatory requirements.翻译:交易员和分析师表示，政府债券供应不断增加，以及新批准的1万亿元人民币（1,366.3亿美元）主权债券发行造成了异常的流动性压力，而此时银行需要调整账目以满足月末监管要求。

Authorities also could have wanted to keep yuan liquidity tight to stem the currency's slide against the U.S. dollar in the foreign exchange market, Becky Liu, head of China macro strategy at Standard Chartered said.翻译:渣打银行(Standard Chartered)中国宏观策略主管刘贝基(Becky Liu)表示，当局也可能希望保持人民币流动性紧张，以阻止人民币兑美元在外汇市场上的下滑。

A trader said a large number of fund houses, brokerages and trust firms were scrambling to borrow money in afternoon trade on Tuesday to avoid defaults as big banks appeared reluctant to lend.翻译:一位交易员表示，周二下午交易中，大量基金公司、经纪公司和信托公司争先恐后地借钱，以避免违约，因为大银行似乎不愿放贷。

"Demand for cash far exceeded supply, boosting short-term rates," the source said. "For each individual institution, it was a rational decision."翻译:消息人士称，“现金需求远远超过供应，推高了短期利率”。 “对于每个机构来说，这是一个理性的决定。”

But regulators on Wednesday told some institutions in a meeting "not to be emotional," another trader source said.翻译:但另一位交易员消息人士称，监管机构周三在一次会议上告诉一些机构“不要情绪化”。

"Everyone is still slightly nervous now. Everyone is prepared and will keep the liquidity ample."翻译:“现在大家还是有点紧张，大家都有准备，会保持流动性充裕。”

($1 = 7.3188 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.3188 人民币）

item.title: 独家：恒大拟境外债权人获得子公司30%股权
item.description:
China Evergrande (3333.HK) has proposed a new debt restructuring plan for offshore bondholders, offering to swap their debts into about a 30% equity stake in each of the developer's two Hong Kong-listed subsidiaries, according to two sources familiar with the matter.翻译:据两位知情人士透露，中国恒大（3333.HK）已向境外债券持有人提出一项新的债务重组计划，提议将其债务转换为该开发商两家香港上市子公司各约30%的股权。

The property firm's offshore bondholders holding about $19 billion of debt are likely to take a major haircut on their investments if they agree to the new terms, said the two sources who declined to be named because they were not authorised to speak with media.翻译:两位因无权接受媒体采访而拒绝透露姓名的消息人士表示，该房地产公司持有约 190 亿美元债务的离岸债券持有人，如果同意新条款，他们的投资可能会大幅削减。

Evergrande did not respond to a request for comment.翻译:恒大没有回应置评请求。

The property developer's dollar bonds last traded at about 2.25 cents on the dollar on Tuesday, according to LSEG data, as bondholders weigh the possible recoveries in the revised restructuring plan against other options like a winding up.翻译:根据伦敦证券交易所数据，周二，该房地产开发商的美元债券最新交易价格约为 2.25 美分，债券持有人正在权衡修订后的重组计划可能带来的复苏与清盘等其他选择。

A lawyer for representing an ad hoc group of key bondholders told a Hong Kong court on Monday the restructuring plan could have a higher recovery rate for creditors than a liquidation scenario of less than 3%.翻译:代表主要债券持有人特别小组的律师周一向香港法院表示，与清算方案相比，重组计划可能为债权人带来更高的回收率（低于 3%）。

Shares in the units the bondholders will be offered the stake in, Evergrande Property Services Group (6666.HK) and Evergrande New Energy Vehicle Group (NEV) (0708.HK), have fallen by more than 80% this year amid Evergrande's debt woes.翻译:恒大物业服务集团（6666.HK）和恒大新能源汽车集团（0708.HK）等债券持有人将被发售的股份今年以来在恒大债务困境中已下跌超过80% 。

Their combined market value was only around HK$9 billion ($1.15 billion) as of Wednesday morning, with the parent holding 52% of the property arm and 59% of the vehicle firm.翻译:截至周三上午，两家公司的总市值仅为 90 亿港元（11.5 亿美元）左右，母公司持有该房地产部门 52% 的股份和该汽车公司 59% 的股份。

Creditors would be given existing shares of the two units, the first source said, in a deal that would need to be approved by Chinese regulators.翻译:第一位消息人士称，债权人将获得这两个部门的现有股份，这笔交易需要得到中国监管机构的批准。

The new plan was raised with some bondholders about two weeks ago, the first source added, after Evergrande's original debt restructuring plan was thrown off course when its billionaire founder Hui Ka Yan was in late September confirmed to be under investigation for suspected criminal activities.翻译:第一位消息人士补充说，大约两周前，恒大集团最初的债务重组计划因亿万富翁创始人许家印被证实因涉嫌犯罪活动而接受调查而被打乱，大约两周前向一些债券持有人提出了这项新计划。

Evergrande was also banned from issuing new dollar bonds, a key part of its original restructuring plan, while its flagship mainland unit was being investigated by regulators.翻译:恒大集团还被禁止发行新的美元债券，这是其最初重组计划的关键部分，而其内地旗舰企业正在接受监管机构的调查。

The second source said the new plan was driven by a work committee under the southern Guangdong provincial government that has been overseeing Evegrande's restructuring since late 2021, after the developer defaulted on its debts. The provincial government did not respond to a request for comment.翻译:第二位消息人士称，这项新计划是由广东省南部省政府下属的一个工作委员会推动的，自 2021 年底以来，在恒大拖欠债务后，该委员会一直负责监督恒大的重组工作。省政府没有回应置评请求。

The renewed proposal will be key to Evergrande's survival as the company was on Monday ordered by a Hong Kong court to form a concrete debt restructuring plan before a liquidation hearing on Dec. 4, which will decide whether it should be wound up.翻译:更新后的提议将是恒大生存的关键，因为香港法院周一命令该公司在 12 月 4 日的清算听证会之前制定具体的债务重组计划，该听证会将决定是否应该清盘。

Evergrande's original plan, which was backed by the ad hoc group of bondholders before it was thrown off course, offered options including equity-linked instruments backed by the parent Evergrande and the two Hong Kong-listed subsidiaries.翻译:恒大最初的计划在偏离轨道之前得到了临时债券持有人小组的支持，该计划提供了包括由母公司恒大和两家香港上市子公司支持的股票挂钩工具在内的期权。

Creditors were allowed to either swap all of their holdings into new notes with maturities of 10 to 12 years, or convert them into different combinations of new notes with tenors of five to nine years and equity-linked instruments, with no direct haircut.翻译:债权人可以将其持有的全部资产交换为期限为 10 至 12 年的新票据，或将其转换为期限为 5 至 9 年的新票据和股票挂钩工具的不同组合，且没有直接折扣。

The biggest challenge ahead for Evergrande will be convincing its creditors and shareholders in the two Hong Kong-listed units that the new proposal is worthwhile, industry experts said.翻译:业内专家表示，恒大面临的最大挑战将是让两家香港上市公司的债权人和股东相信新提议是值得的。

A key group of creditors, categorized as Class C by Evergrande, including private lenders, some Chinese banks and pre-IPO investors had opposed the old plan and demanded better terms before it collapsed.翻译:被恒大归类为C级的关键债权人群体，包括私人贷款机构、一些中资银行和IPO前的投资者，反对旧计划，并在计划崩溃前要求更好的条款。

The ad hoc group of bondholders is unhappy about the revised terms offering equity in the Hong Kong-listed subsidiaries, according to sources.翻译:据消息人士透露，债券持有人特别小组对香港上市子公司股权修订后的条款感到不满。

($1 = 7.8239 Hong Kong dollars)翻译:(1 美元 = 7.8239 港元)

item.title: 美国立法者向拜登施压，要求其制定中国使用开放芯片技术的计划
item.description:
A wider bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers is asking the Biden administration about its plans to respond to China's rising use of RISC-V chip design technology after Reuters last month reported on growing concerns about it in both houses of Congress.翻译:在路透社上个月报道国会两院对 RISC-V 芯片设计技术日益增长的担忧之后，一个由美国两党议员组成的更广泛的团体正在询问拜登政府计划如何应对中国越来越多地使用 RISC-V 芯片设计技术。

RISC-V, pronounced "risk five," is a free open-source technology that competes with costly proprietary technology from British semiconductor and software design company Arm Holdings (O9Ty.F), and Intel Corp (INTC.O). It can be used as a key part of anything from a smartphone chip to advanced processors for artificial intelligence.翻译:RISC-V，发音为“风险五”，是一种免费的开源技术，与英国半导体和软件设计公司 Arm Holdings (O9Ty.F)和英特尔公司(INTC.O)昂贵的专有技术竞争。它可以用作从智能手机芯片到人工智能高级处理器等任何事物的关键部分。

U.S. firms such as Qualcomm (QCOM.O) and Alphabet's (GOOGL.O) Google have embraced RISC-V, but so too have many Chinese companies.翻译:高通(QCOM.O)和 Alphabet (GOOGL.O)谷歌等美国公司已经采用了 RISC-V，但许多中国公司也是如此。

Reuters last month reported that at least four influential U.S. lawmakers view Chinese use of the technology as a potential national security threat because RISC-V is not captured by the sweeping export controls the U.S. has imposed on sending chip technology to China.翻译:路透社上个月报道称，至少四名有影响力的美国立法者认为中国对该技术的使用构成潜在的国家安全威胁，因为美国对向中国出口芯片技术实施的全面出口管制并未涵盖 RISC-V。

Now, a broader group of 18 lawmakers that includes five Democrats is asking the Biden administration for how it plans to prevent China "from achieving dominance in ... RISC-V technology and leveraging that dominance at the expense of U.S. national and economic security," according to a letter the group sent to Raimondo and seen by Reuters.翻译:现在，包括 5 名民主党人在内的 18 名立法者正在向拜登政府询问计划如何阻止中国“在 RISC-V 技术领域取得主导地位，并以牺牲美国国家和经济安全为代价利用这种主导地位， ”根据路透社看到的该组织发给雷蒙多的一封信。

The lawmakers include the Republican chairman and ranking Democrat from a select committee on China in the House of Representatives as well as Democratic lawmakers from New Jersey, Florida, Michigan and Indiana. They also asked the Biden administration about how it might apply an existing executive order to require U.S. companies to get an export license before working with Chinese companies on RISC-V technology.翻译:议员们包括众议院中国问题特别委员会的共和党主席和民主党资深议员，以及来自新泽西州、佛罗里达州、密歇根州和印第安纳州的民主党议员。他们还询问拜登政府如何应用现有的行政命令，要求美国公司在与中国公司合作开发 RISC-V 技术之前必须获得出口许可证。

"While the benefits of open-source collaboration on RISC-V promise to be significant for advancement and development of the U.S. semiconductor industry, it can only be realized when contributors are working with the sole aim of improving the technology, and not aiding the technological goals and geopolitical interests of" China, the group of lawmakers wrote in the letter.翻译:“虽然 RISC-V 开源合作的好处有望对美国半导体行业的进步和发展具有重大意义，但只有当贡献者的唯一目标是改进技术而不是帮助技术进步时，它才能实现。中国的目标和地缘政治利益”，议员们在信中写道。

A Commerce Department spokesperson said Raimondo had received the letter and would respond through the appropriate channels.翻译:商务部发言人表示，雷蒙多已收到这封信，并将通过适当渠道做出回应。

Reporting by Stephen Nellis in San Francisco; Editing by Jamie Freed翻译:斯蒂芬·内利斯 (Stephen Nellis) 旧金山报道；杰米·弗里德编辑

item.title: 中国称官员将率团参加中美核谈判
item.description:
The Chinese foreign ministry said on Thursday a leading official from its department of arms control affairs will lead a delegation in China-U.S. nuclear talks.翻译:中国外交部周四表示，军控司一位主要官员将率团参加中美核谈判。

The ministry did not name the official.翻译:该部没有透露该官员的姓名。

"Next week in Washington, China and U.S. will hold arms control and non-proliferation consultations at director-general level," spokesperson Wang Wenbin said when asked about a report that China agreed to nuclear arms-control talks with the United States.翻译:当被问及有关中国同意与美国进行核军控谈判的报道时，发言人汪文斌表示：“中美下周将在华盛顿举行司长级军控与防扩散磋商。”

According to plans agreed by both sides, Wang said China and the U.S. will conduct dialogue and exchanges on a wide range of issues such as implementation of international arms control treaties.翻译:王毅表示，根据双方商定的计划，中美双方将就执行国际军控条约等广泛问题开展对话与交流。

The talks come days after Foreign Minister Wang Yi met with senior U.S. officials, with both sides agreeing to hold a series of consultations in the near future.翻译:几天前，外交部长王毅会见了美国高级官员，双方同意在不久的将来举行一系列磋商。

Wang also met with U.S. President Biden in talks that the White House described as a "good opportunity" in terms of keeping lines of communication open between the two geopolitical rivals with deep policy differences.翻译:王毅还与美国总统拜登进行了会谈，白宫称此次会谈是保持两个政策分歧深刻的地缘政治对手之间沟通渠道畅通的“好机会”。

Reporting by Laurie Chen; Writing by Bernard Orr; Editing by Sonali Paul and Edwina Gibbs翻译:陈劳瑞报道；伯纳德·奥尔撰写；索纳莉·保罗和埃德温娜·吉布斯编辑

item.title: 北京入冬晚一周，华北地区天气温暖
item.description:
Winter is expected to arrive late, and suddenly in Beijing this year as daytime temperatures hovered above 20 degrees Celsius (68 Fahrenheit), bathing the capital in a warm smog, while other parts of China basked in record highs above 30C.翻译:预计今年北京的冬天会来得较晚，而且会突然到来，白天气温徘徊在 20 摄氏度（68 华氏度）以上，让首都沐浴在温暖的雾霾之中，而中国其他地区的气温则创下了 30 摄氏度以上的历史新高。

The official start of winter in the capital could come on Nov. 6, state-run Beijing Daily reported on Wednesday, almost a week later than in previous years, with average temperatures expected to dive more than 10C.翻译:据国营《北京日报》周三报道，首都冬季可能会在11月6日正式开始，比往年晚了近一周，平均气温预计将下降10摄氏度以上。

The weather in many parts of China had stayed stubbornly warm entering November, with cities in eastern and central provinces such as Shandong, Anhui, Jiangsu and Henan still logging temperatures above 30C.翻译:进入11月，我国多地天气持续高温，山东、安徽、江苏、河南等东部和中部省份城市气温仍然在30℃以上。

As of 2 p.m. (0600 GMT) on Wednesday, more than 600 meteorological stations across China had seen temperatures shatter historical highs for November, according to the official Xinhua news agency.翻译:据官方新华社报道，截至周三下午 2 点（格林威治标准时间 0600），中国各地 600 多个气象站的气温打破了 11 月份的历史新高。

One station in eastern China's Jinan city recorded an average temperature of 25C on Wednesday, 12.6C higher than normal and resembling a level observed at the end of August, Jim Yang, a researcher at the China Meteorological Administration, said on the social media platform X.翻译:中国气象局研究员杨吉姆在社交媒体平台X上表示，中国东部济南市的一个站点周三平均气温为25℃，比正常高12.6℃，与8月底的水平相似。 。

Beijing logged its second-warmest October last month in over 60 years. Temperatures also averaged 3.4C higher than normal in the last 10 days of the month, a record for the same period since 1961.翻译:上个月，北京经历了 60 多年来第二个最热的 10 月。本月最后 10 天平均气温也比正常水平高出 3.4 摄氏度，创下 1961 年以来同期最高纪录。

In tandem with the warm weather, smog has also shrouded Beijing and its surrounding areas for days.翻译:随着天气转暖，雾霾也连续多日笼罩北京及周边地区。

On Thursday, heavy and dense fog is forecast to envelop regions including Beijing and surrounding cities for the fifth day, with visibility dropping below 200 metres in parts of Hebei province, China's National Meteorological Center said.翻译:中国国家气象中心预计，周四，北京及周边城市将连续第五天出现大雾，河北部分地区能见度降至200米以下。

Experts quoted by state media say the recent "rare" summer-like weather was due to weaker-than-usual cold air currents, which had also led to persistent hazy weather with heavy air pollution shrouding the city.翻译:官方媒体援引专家的话称，近期出现“罕见”的夏季天气是由于冷气流弱于平常，这也导致持续的雾霾天气，严重的空气污染笼罩着这座城市。

In coming days, temperatures across northern China are expected to drop sharply. Northeastern cities such as Shenyang, Changchun and Harbin would see a sharp drop of more than 15C.翻译:未来几天，华北地区气温预计将大幅下降。沉阳、长春、哈尔滨等东北城市气温将大幅下降15℃以上。

Other cities such as Beijing, Zhengzhou, Jinan, Xian and Shijiazhuang will see a sudden decline of 10C to 15C.翻译:北京、郑州、济南、西安、石家庄等城市气温将骤降10℃至15℃。

Reporting by Ethan Wang, Ryan Woo and Shanghai Newsroom; Editing by Simon Cameron-Moore翻译:Ethan Wang、Ryan Woo 和上海新闻编辑室的报道；西蒙·卡梅伦-摩尔 编辑
item.author: Ethan Wang, Ryan Woo

item.title: 菲律宾警方追捕六名被绑架中国公民
item.description:
Philippine authorities were trying to track the whereabouts of six Chinese nationals who were abducted in the capital region this week, police said on Thursday.翻译:警方周四表示，菲律宾当局正在试图追踪本周在首都地区被绑架的六名中国公民的下落。

Police anti-kidnapping chief Cosme Abrenica said authorities were investigating the abduction of nine people on Monday in an upscale neighbourhood in southern Metro Manila. Six of the victims were Chinese, who remain missing, and three were Filipino who were released shortly after they were abducted.翻译:警方反绑架负责人科斯梅·阿布伦尼卡 (Cosme Abrenica) 表示，当局正在调查周一在马尼拉大都会南部一个高档社区发生的九人绑架事件。其中六名受害者是中国人，目前仍然失踪，三名受害者是菲律宾人，他们在被绑架后不久就被释放。

"We have no information if it's kidnap-for-ransom, kidnapping or what the motive is. We haven't established it yet," Abrenica said.翻译:“我们不知道这是否是绑架勒索、绑架或动机是什么。我们还没有确定，”阿布雷尼卡说。

Abrenica did not disclose the identities of the victims or give any details on their status in the Philippines.翻译:Abrenica 没有透露受害者的身份，也没有提供有关他们在菲律宾的状况的任何详细信息。

Philip Aguilar, the police chief of Calauan town where the Filipino victims were recovered, said one of the survivors told them the kidnappers had barged into their home before dawn on Monday.翻译:菲律宾受害者被找到的卡劳安镇警察局长菲利普·阿吉拉尔表示，其中一名幸存者告诉他们，绑匪周一黎明前闯入了他们的家。

The Chinese embassy in Manila said it had noted a request from Reuters for comment.翻译:中国驻马尼拉大使馆表示，已注意到路透社的置评请求。

While police said the motive for this week's kidnapping was not known, China has in the past complained to the Philippines about its citizens being lured to work in online gaming firms and then being cheated, extorted and exposed to “modern slavery”.翻译:虽然警方表示本周绑架的动机尚不清楚，但中国过去曾向菲律宾抱怨其公民被引诱到网络游戏公司工作，然后遭到欺骗、勒索并遭受“现代奴隶制”。

Reporting by Mikhail Flores; editing by Robert Birsel翻译:米哈伊尔·弗洛雷斯报道；罗伯特·伯塞尔编辑

item.title: 中国同意与美国进行核军控谈判 - 华尔街日报
item.description:
China and the United States will discuss nuclear arms control next week, the first such talks since the Obama administration, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.翻译:据《华尔街日报》周三报道，中国和美国将于下周讨论核军控问题，这是自奥巴马政府以来的首次此类会谈。

China's Foreign Ministry said on Monday after a visit by Foreign Minister Wang Yi to Washington that the two countries would hold "consultations on arms control and non-proliferation" in the coming days, as well as separate talks on maritime affairs and other issues.翻译:中国外交部周一在外交部长王毅访问华盛顿后表示，两国将在未来几天举行“军控和防扩散磋商”，并就海洋事务和其他问题举行单独会谈。

Those arms talks would be led on Monday by Mallory Stewart, a senior State Department official, and Sun Xiaobo, the head of the arms-control department at China's Foreign Ministry, the Wall Street Journal report said.翻译:据《华尔街日报》报道，这些军备谈判将于周一由国务院高级官员马洛里·斯图尔特和中国外交部军控司司长孙晓波主持。

The U.S. State Department and China's embassy in Washington did not immediately respond to requests by Reuters for comment on the timing or format of the talks.翻译:美国国务院和中国驻华盛顿大使馆没有立即回应路透社就会谈时间或形式发表评论的请求。

U.S. National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said in 2021 that the Chinese and U.S. presidents had agreed to "look to begin to carry forward discussion on strategic stability", a reference to Washington's concerns about Beijing's nuclear weapons build-up.翻译:美国国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文 (Jake Sullivan) 于 2021 年表示，中美两国总统已同意“寻求开始推进有关战略稳定的讨论”，这指的是华盛顿对北京核武器集结的担忧。

But the White House was quick to say at the time that the discussions would not resemble formal arms reduction talks, like those the U.S. has had with Russia.翻译:但白宫当时很快表示，此次讨论与美国与俄罗斯进行的正式削减军备谈判不同。

Since then, U.S. officials had expressed frustration that China showed little interest in discussing steps to reduce nuclear weapons risks.翻译:此后，美国官员对中国对讨论降低核武器风险的措施兴趣不大表示失望。

China has more than 500 operational nuclear warheads in its arsenal and will probably have over 1,000 warheads by 2030, the Pentagon said in October. But Beijing has long argued that the U.S. already has a much larger arsenal. The arms talks would occur before a likely meeting between U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping in San Francisco in November, although a senior Biden administration official said on Tuesday important details have yet to be hammered out.翻译:五角大楼去年 10 月表示，中国的武库中拥有超过 500 枚可使用的核弹头， 到 2030 年可能会拥有超过 1,000 枚核弹头。但北京长期以来一直认为美国已经拥有更大的核武库。军备谈判将在美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平可能于 11 月在旧金山举行会议之前进行，不过拜登政府高级官员周二表示，重要细节尚未敲定。

A flurry of China-U.S. diplomatic engagements in recent months, largely at Washington's request, has sought to salvage what were rapidly deteriorating ties between the two countries following the U.S. downing in February of a suspected Chinese spy balloon over the United States.翻译:近几个月来，中美两国在很大程度上应华盛顿的要求进行了一系列外交接触，试图挽救自美国二月份击落美国上空疑似中国间谍气球以来迅速恶化的两国关系。

Daryl Kimball, executive director of the Washington-based Arms Control Association, said the overdue arms talks would likely focus on promoting greater transparency of each countries' nuclear doctrines and more effective crisis-communication channels.翻译:总部位于华盛顿的军备控制协会执行董事达里尔·金博尔表示，迟来的军备谈判可能会集中于提高各国核理论的透明度和更有效的危机沟通渠道。

"I don't think, however, we should expect breakthroughs in the near term. That's going to take time and give and take from both sides," Kimball said.翻译:“然而，我认为我们不应期望在短期内取得突破。这需要时间，需要双方的妥协，”金博尔说。

Reporting by Jasper Ward, Dan Whitcomb, Michael Martina and David Brunnstrom; Editing by Sandra Maler and Grant McCool翻译:Jasper Ward、Dan Whitcomb、Michael Martina 和 David Brunnstrom 报道；桑德拉·马勒和格兰特·麦库尔编辑
